summary: This bill, the Securing and Enabling Commerce Using Remote and Electronic Notarization Act of 2025, authorizes notaries public to perform electronic and remote notarizations in interstate commerce. It establishes minimum standards for these notarizations, including requirements for electronic signatures, recording of remote notarizations, and identification of remotely located individuals. The bill also mandates federal and state courts to recognize notarizations performed by notarial officers from other states, clarifying the legal effect of such notarizations and addressing related legal presumptions. It includes provisions on state oversight, exceptions to preemption, and addresses false advertising related to notarial services.
